step1.sentence: He wound up spending the entire afternoon helping his neighbor fix the fence.

step2.story: She started studying for one exam and wound up reviewing the entire semester's notes without meaning to. By midnight, she felt more prepared than she had expected.

step3.story: The business trip was supposed to last three days. Then a storm grounded all the flights on day two. Jake wound up staying five days in a city he had never planned to explore. He visited museums, ate at a local market, and made a friend at a small cafe near the hotel. He later said the delay was the best part of the whole trip.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 의도하지 않게 어떤 상황이나 상태에 결국 처하게 되다.
meaning.realUsageKo: end up과 비슷하지만 더 구어적이며 계획과 달리 어떤 결과에 이르는 상황에 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: wind(감다, 이어지다)와 up(결과)이 결합하여 이어지고 이어져 결국 어떤 상태에 다다른다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: end up과 의미가 거의 같지만 조금 더 구어체적입니다. 의도치 않은 결과의 뉘앙스가 강합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: We wound up at a tiny ramen shop after walking around for an hour.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 한 시간 동안 걷다가 결국 작은 라멘집에 가게 됐어요.
